intro: Hirtella zenkeri, commonly known as the hairy hirtella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of eastern Brazil, where it thrives in humid, tropical climates. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom throughout the year, attracting various pollinators. Hirtella zenkeri is often found in shaded understory environments, growing on rocky or disturbed soils.
